content.text: Accessibility Color Alone as Meaning
Why

links.text: Red-green color blindness is the most common form
grayscale mode to curb their phone addiction

content.text: Not everyone perceives color the same way. Red-green color blindness is the most common form , it affects up to 8% of males. Some use grayscale mode to curb their phone addiction .
content.html: Not everyone perceives color the same way. Red-green color blindness is the most common form, it affects up to 8% of males. Some use grayscale mode to curb their phone addiction.

content.text: What
Do not use color as the only visual indicator of a meaning.
content.html: Do not use color as the only visual indicator of a meaning.

content.text: The most common example of this is to style links without underline or border.
content.html: The most common example of this is to style links without underline or border.

content.text: Browsers underline hypertext links by default. It is possible to remove the underline using Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), but this is a bad idea most of the time. Users are accustomed to seeing links underlined.
content.html: Browsers underline hypertext links by default. It is possible to remove the underline using Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), but this is a bad idea most of the time. Users are accustomed to seeing links underlined.

content.text: WebAIM: Links and Hypertext
Wikipedia is one example where color alone is used for styling links. In the grayscale version of the site, it is not possible to see what is plain text and what is a link.
content.html: Wikipedia is one example where color alone is used for styling links. In the grayscale version of the site, it is not possible to see what is plain text and what is a link.

content.text: How
Underlined links
Add underline to links. Or, do not remove them. Keep in mind that they can reduce readability.
content.html: Add underline to links. Or, do not remove them. Keep in mind that they can reduce readability.

content.text: To improve readability, we can use CSS properties like text-underline-offset and text-decoration-color .
content.html: To improve readability, we can use CSS properties like text-underline-offset and text-decoration-color.

content.text: Color as status
Add text and/or icons to communicate meaning, in addition to color.
content.html: Add text and/or icons to communicate meaning, in addition to color.

Note: The following tools gives a rating for the contrast assuming that you are using it as text color.

content.text: Many combinations that are not suitable as background/color combinations, are perfectly usable as colors for graphics, buttons, etc.

content.text: The tool Contrast Ratio uses color to communicate if a color contrast is good or not. Red means bad contrast. In this example you might say that the number is another indicator. That is a valid argument. However, you are then assuming that the user understands the metric contrast ratio and knows about the guidelines.
